title: Question:
author: Saisher
content: You can when you won a huge amount There's a discussion here of a guy who won a huge amount but added that he is quitting gambling is it really possible, anyone here have done quitting after winning a huge amount You can when you lose a huge amount This is the most popular reason to quit have you done this only to come backYou can anytime you wantDo you have the power to do it anytime that you want.You have to when you're wife tells you toI know a lot of guys who quit gambling for good after their wives tell them to, do you know of someone, or at one time you are one of them.Let's discuss this and thank you for participating.

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: In my opinion, you can quit anytime you want.It is your will power and sheer determination that will guide you to change lifestyle.Look for very good reason that you think can motivate you to change from your habits.All the other individuals outside of you are just there to assist you with your change, but the mainactor of this change will be you only. If you decide to change, always remind yourself you are doing this for good.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: If you are really putting yourself in the right mindset to quit, you can do it anytime. No money needed if you don't want to spend it. As long as you're sure that you don't have a gambling problem, then there's no reason why you can't have a bit of fun with it. If your gambling is causing financial problems, then it might be time to take a step back and reevaluate your relationship with the casino. That's why it's important to have fun and enjoy yourself in the process instead of trying to win big.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can when you won a huge amount There's a discussion here of a guy who won a huge amount but added that he is quitting gambling is it really possible, anyone here have done quitting after winning a huge amount I think I'm familiar with the thread that you are referring and as I have said there, no, it might be difficult to quit because you win big, on the contrary, as per my experience, you wanted more and so you comeback and play.Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can when you lose a huge amount This is the most popular reason to quit have you done this only to come backAgain, I will answer base on my experience, maybe I quit like a month or so after a huge lost. But when everything settles down, and I have a capital in my hand and totally rejuvenated, then I will go back again.Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can anytime you wantDo you have the power to do it anytime that you want.Of course, it's all in our mind, maybe if you have enough push within you, might quit for good.Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou have to when you're wife tells you toI know a lot of guys who quit gambling for good after their wives tell them to, do you know of someone, or at one time you are one of them.Let's discuss this and thank you for participating.What if your wife is also a gambling?   it could be a very difficult situation for you and for her to stop gambling for good.

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: "You can when you won a huge amount"This is not easy, rarely gamblers can do it. When winning big every gambler want more, and more. But not all people because it depends on the character too."You can when you lose a huge amount"It's not that simple, even when loses huge amount at gambling, we will out of control and will try again next."You can anytime you want"Honestly I can, because I doing a gambling with full awareness, but for addicts this is difficult."You have to when you're wife tells you to"I don't believe this, because so far if the hobby is prevented it will be crazier.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Very possible if you have the drive and the courage to do so. Most of the time, our only enemy agains this is ourselves and our self-control. Since gambling is one of the actovities that we always do, it will be quite hard to break it even if we use one of the mentioned triggers to stop playing because we think that it's okay to still play one last game.I'd probably stop if I can spend weekends on an entirely different activity that will make me engaged and hooked at all times.

comments.author: milewilda
comments.body: You can when you lose a huge amountPeople do usually quit when they do experience this thing which is really just that typical.How you would be able to play if you dont have money to be spent?Its indeed impossible for someone to quit when they are still on the verge of winning times or moments which you would be mainly thinking that you should playeven more and hoping for more winning hits which it is a typical gambler mindset where it do really pushes you or motivate you on playing even more.YOu wont stop as long you do have the money you could pull into your pocket and this had been always the case.

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Honestly, treating your gambling activity shouldn't end up on too much technicality. It's really not necessary to quit as long as you are disciplined and responsible. Gambling is not that bad if you managed to play it right. If quitting is really a must, then no choice but to help yourself and aggressively force yourself to stop gambling for good.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: I pick the QuoteYou can when you lose a huge amount it happens to me before I really quit but only to come back as a much better gambler, losing a huge amount and quitting right away is good for your mental health, it made you realize your mistake and become better the next time you come back, I quit, but back again after two weeks with good control of my urge. Every time I am on the brink of losing my control I just remember the pain of losing huge.

comments.author: jakelyson
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can when you won a huge amount There's a discussion here of a guy who won a huge amount but added that he is quitting gambling is it really possible, anyone here have done quitting after winning a huge amount I think it is quite the opposite. Instead of quitting, you might actually get hooked to gambling. If you are a first timer, then that is a good hook. If you are an old-time gambler, it is just additional fund to gamble more. Winning a big amount is not a good deterrent to gambling. Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can when you lose a huge amount This is the most popular reason to quit have you done this only to come backThis is possible unless you are an addicted gambler. NO number of losses can deter you from gambling. Instead of quitting, you will find more money to fund your gambling addiction. That is how addicts bankrupt their resources. But I think not so many are like this. I for sure, if accrued a very large lost will stop gambling. At least for a while.Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can anytime you wantDo you have the power to do it anytime that you want.This is a case-to-case basis. It depends on the person if he has the will to quit gambling. Others do not have the will to control their habits or addiction. You are lucky if you are one of the people who have the will to control their gambling habits or quit it totally.Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou have to when you're wife tells you toI know a lot of guys who quit gambling for good after their wives tell them to, do you know of someone, or at one time you are one of them.Let's discuss this and thank you for participating.This could help #3 especially if the wife is very supportive of you. But if she is just going to nag you about gambling, I think the result will be the opposite. Many men hate to be nagged by their wives, but some are willing to change because of their wives when properly approached, supported and guided.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on October 30, 2022, 11:39:41 PMI pick the QuoteYou can when you lose a huge amount it happens to me before I really quit but only to come back as a much better gambler, losing a huge amount and quitting right away is good for your mental health, it made you realize your mistake and become better the next time you come back, I quit, but back again after two weeks with good control of my urge. Every time I am on the brink of losing my control I just remember the pain of losing huge.Only if others will end up with the same as yours.Unfortunately, losing a huge amount might trigger the desire to gamble more to chase the loss. That's the reality for most gamblers. The eagerness to recover that amount will just be fueled more because the loss amount is really big.To quit gambling, there's no other way but to become dedicated to doing so.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: I think the 2nd, 3rd and 4th reasons goes more than the first would ever go.Let's look at someone like Drake most of all. He's got all that he wants from his career and by that am saying, money is hardly his problem, he has lost huge and at the same time, won huge but still, he continues to gamble. What might his purpose be?Perhaps it's it's deal his got with stake.com to keep the gambling going or maybe he just having fun while trying out his luck.Winning huge is hardly any reason. It might be a reason for a day to end the session and try again tomorrow, same with loses but to quit gambling, I doubt that. Most huge wins are seen as lxuky money, extra cash and so, you just want to use it as you want. What better way would that be than to try and win more. Eventually, you end up sending it right back to the house. Some addictive path gamblers take.

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: I think you can quit gambling at any point really, it's all in your mind.Personally I think the best time to quit gambling is when you just won.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Everyone could quit gambling if they would want to; it is just a matter of self- discipline. Greed and money are the main factors why a gambler continues to play. Best thing to do is diversion of activity. Find something that would consume your time and eventually it would replace the hours you are spending in gambling activities. Make friends as well who are not into betting because if you will be still surrounded by people who are into it, you'll surely have a hard time to get over it.Losing a huge amount, to some people, is enough to give up on something but there are people who will get more drive from such instance or to simply play more. Likewise with winning big time.

comments.author: STT
comments.created_time: October 30, 2022, 11:58:19 PMLast edit: October 31, 2022, 12:20:32 AM by STT
comments.body: Out all of those options, the hardest time to quit is when you have just won I think.  From pure self will with no encouragement to walk away at this point, its all solely on the person as a personal choice.  Hence that is the strongest of the 4 in terms of will power, I would believe this person as most probable to be resolute over other options.     I would be looking for a winning streak after 1 win I'd like more to counter my prior losses so I wont or have never done this.  Surely everyone likes to think they only quit when no win is coming, that would appear smartest.    Its very hard to know which time is best to walk away or continue, the wife option I kinda disbelieve maybe a temporary quit due to forced reasoning however much you like your wife.    Being forced to quit when stumped by a big loss,  a cessation from necessity does not count imo; a few will not come back but a vast majority this is only a temporary stop when there is no choice in your decision.

comments.author: chaser15
comments.body: Quote from: TimeTeller on October 30, 2022, 09:57:30 PMIn my opinion, you can quit anytime you want.It is your will power and sheer determination that will guide you to change lifestyle.Look for very good reason that you think can motivate you to change from your habits.All the other individuals outside of you are just there to assist you with your change, but the mainactor of this change will be you only. If you decide to change, always remind yourself you are doing this for good.This is correct and only we can do it. If we are really determined to quit gambling, we must start with ourselves regardless of what are those reasons we are waiting for before quitting. There are different things that a gambler can lead in stopping gambling and we don't know the specific reason for that.Let's always hope for the best when doing gambling as it not just as money at risks here but also our social life and relation to our families.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: Those four reasons are good enough for a gambler to quit gambling, but then again it's easy to come up with different reasons based on the gambler's experience than to successfully quit gambling. Others might've failed to quit but like what TimeTeller said it comes down to you and how you're going to make it work on your end since it's always possible for anyone to successfully quit regardless of the reason and as long as they're determined to reach that goal.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on October 30, 2022, 09:55:19 PMYou can when you lose a huge amount This is the most popular reason to quit have you done this only to come backComing back again because the impulse wins. It's possible that the person who loses a huge amount is his everything. Having something new to do or a new job opportunity I think will help more than a wife yelling to stop. The gambler will just secretly gamble, that is what will happen just like a guy having an affair.
